channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Data Garden

item.title: Intro: Parallelität
DataWarehouse-Architecture
item.description: Data Flow Reference Architecture Service may be available in the Core Data Warehouse Data Mart: small portion of the Warehouse, to organize small portions DataWarehouse Manager: allows acces to end user controls extraction, transformation, load, monitor Metadata-Manager if sth is added to the source, metadata needs to be added as well needed for transformation Basic Elements Source Systems Characterisitcs narrow queries no broad queries as in DW little historical data dimensions differ from other legacy systems use of keys to make certain things unique (product, customer,…) Selection Criteria purpose of the DW; what is the goal?

item.title: Data Warehouse Design
item.description: Recap Database Design DW Design Process more or less same steps as DB-Design our topics: Dimensional Fact Model & mUML & starER Conceptual Design Transformation of the semi-formal business requirements specification into a formalized conceptual multidimensional schema most produce a graphical multidimensional schema Dimensional Fact Model, UML-based, starER Conceptual DEsign based on business requirement specification schema of operational systems Process model to conceptual DW-Design context definition of measures dimensional hierarchy design summarizability constraints Logical Design Convert the conceptual schema to a logical one with respect to the target data model.

item.title: Intro: Data-Warehouse, OLAP
item.description: Heterogeneous Data Sources Broad range of data sources database systems(relational, object-relational, XML,..) Enterprise Resource Palnning Systems (ERP) external information sources (other companies, surveys, …) files (Excel, …) other documents (Word, WWW, …) Data Sources may differ in schema coding schemes time frame (when is data sent) treatment of history aggregation level (in which time frames is data stored) DBMS (data model, vendor, version) Data Warehouse Operational vs. Analytical Systems Important Terms Data Warehousing is the process of integrating data from several source systems, storing it in the data warehouse database, and using this integrated data source.
